organization.fullName: The First Affiliated Hospital of Xiamen University

identificationModule.briefTitle: Prospective Clinical Study of Obrutinib in Combination With Rituximab (OR) for Primary Marginal Zone Lymphoma (MZL) That Failed or Not Suitable for Local Therapy
identificationModule.officialTitle: Prospective Clinical Study of Obrutinib in Combination With Rituximab (OR) for Primary Marginal Zone Lymphoma (MZL) That Failed or Not Suitable for Local Therapy

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: The First Affiliated Hospital of Xiamen University

leadSponsor.name: The First Affiliated Hospital of Xiamen University

collaborators.name: The First Hospital of Jilin University
The Second Affiliated Hospital of Dalian Medical University

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Obrutinib combined with rituximab (OR) therapy were used to assess the efficacy and safety for newly diagnosed Marginal zone cell lymphoma

armGroups.label: OR
interventionNames: Drug: Obrutinib in combination with rituximab

interventions.name: Obrutinib in combination with rituximab
interventions.description:
Induction Phase:

Obrutinib + rituximab for a total of 6 cycles of 28 days each Obrutinib (O) 150mg oral d1-28 Rituximab (R) 375mg/m2 IV d0

Maintenance phase:

Obrutinib 150mg po qd 24 cycles of 28 days each

primaryOutcomes.description: Complete remission rate (according to Lugano 2014 criteria)

overallOfficials.name: Bing Xu
overallOfficials.affiliation: The First Aiffiliated hosptical of xiamen University
